I would be happy to initially seed a collection or two--assuming I had twentyforty's permission to do so, but unhappily I haven't yet figured out how to post torrents and get them accepted by tpb tracker (or any other for that matter) and my upload speed ain't all that good, so it would probably be a week or more of continuous initial seeding even if I Did manage to figure it out. :(

@@hkoraddi: As you learned, my friend, through all years you have followed me, I remember all "open things", and your asking about Tangled PPV. I did. But, as you surely know, my encoding has changed, dramatically. Nowadays, my 720p are 7 MB/minute and "old" and partially abandoned 272p were 4.44 MB/minute in cases like these, when source has full wide-screen aspect ratio of 16/9 and not theatrical 2.25-2.35/1 (narrow-wide or Cinemascope). Point being, 272p would be roughly 450MB (it's 100 min. movie) and weighting the size gain, savings by that - but getting much worse quality - I opted for 700MB-720p as a try to achieve "one size fits all", but it  obviously wasn't the case. I stopped with encoding of so called "double-releases" (272p and 720p of the same movie) for one simple reason -  I can't make it.

In my first answer I tried to keep things simple (therefore such "shortness") and I am sorry for that.

@azrielle: As I said like gazillion times, my "regulars" do not need any permission from me. In fact, I encouraged people to make season collections and make torrents, therefore I made and posted "How.to.Make.a.torrent.avi" and "How.to.Upload.torrent.avi" 3.5 MB videos in every MU.txt file which was incorporated in many of my torrents, but nobody (or few) actually looked into. I have 54 kB/s upload speed and that is considered as lowest limit for uploads. I would send you  these MU links in e-mail and you'll see how simple it is.
@twentyforty: Please send those links to me as well in the email friend. I would like to do it too. Thanks !!
